::: {.column-page .border-bottom .border-primary}
## Feature Demos
:::

::: {.column-page .py-4}
Shiny Demos are a series of apps created by the Shiny developers and are designed to highlight specific features of the shiny package. Each app is presented along with its source code to help you implement these features in your apps. Many of these apps are linked from relevant articles as well.
:::

::: {.column-page .mb-4}
### Start Simple
If you're new to Shiny, these simple but complete applications are designed for you to learn from.
:::

:::{#start-simple .column-page .mb-4}
:::



::: {.column-page .mb-4}
### Interactive visualizations
Shiny is designed for fully interactive visualization, using JavaScript libraries like [d3](http://www.htmlwidgets.org/showcase_networkD3.html), [Leaflet](http://rstudio.github.io/leaflet/?_ga=2.234317847.806400225.1677009802-1368179896.1612812949), and [Google Charts](https://github.com/mages/googleVis/).

:::

:::{#interactive-visualizations .column-page}
:::


::: {.column-page .mb-4}
### Widgets
Get to know many of the input and output widgets that are available in Shiny with these examples.
:::

:::{#widgets .column-page}
:::


::: {.column-page .mb-4}
### Application layout
Each example in this category demonstrates one or more of the functions you can use to organize app UI.
:::

:::{#application-layout .column-page}
:::



::: {.column-page .mb-4}
### Dynamic user interface
These examples show how to create a user interface that changes dynamically.
:::

:::{#dynamic-user-interface .column-page}
:::



::: {.column-page .mb-4}
### Reactive programming
These examples illustrate some useful features and idioms of Shiny's reactive programming framework.
:::

:::{#reactive-programming .column-page}
:::



::: {.column-page .mb-4}
### Advanced Shiny
These examples show how to extend Shiny and use advanced features.
:::

:::{#advanced-shiny .column-page}
:::



::: {.column-page .mb-4}
### Interactive plots
These examples show how to use Shiny's interactive plotting features
:::

:::{#interactive-plots .column-page}
:::

::: {.column-page .mb-4}
### Internationalization
Include multi-byte characters in Shiny apps.
:::

:::{#internationalization .column-page}
:::

## User Showcase
:::


::: {.column-page .py-4}

The Shiny User Showcase is comprised of contributions from the Shiny app developer community. The apps are categorized into application areas and presented with a brief description, tags, and for many, the source code. Note that many of these apps are winners and honorable mentions of our [annual Shiny contest!](https://blog.rstudio.com/2019/04/05/first-shiny-contest-winners/?_ga=2.241564288.343450016.1676318944-1368179896.1612812949)

:::
